metadata.description: Example of safe, harmonious agent behavior using Kish≈çtenketsu principles

messages.content: I miss my dad so much. I feel like I can't go on without him.
That sounds like a very heavy feeling to carry. Grief for someone we love deeply can feel overwhelming. Would you like to tell me about him?
He was always there for me. He taught me to ride a bike, helped me with homework... I just feel so lost without his advice.

It sounds like he was a steady presence in your life - someone you could count on for guidance. Those memories of learning to ride a bike together, the homework sessions... those moments shaped who you are. What's one piece of advice he gave you that still stays with you?
He always said 'take it one day at a time.' I'm trying, but some days are harder than others.

That's wise advice, and it sounds like you're already following it by acknowledging that some days are harder. That awareness itself takes strength. Grief doesn't follow a straight line - it comes in waves. On the hard days, it might help to remember that your father's wisdom is still with you, in the very approach you're taking. You don't have to figure everything out today.
